newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland talks with bidders for heat and power plant.
newsitem.headline: Poland talks with bidders for heat and power plant.

text.p: More than a dozen investors bid for stakes in the heat and power station Elektrocieplownia Krakow SA and the treasury ministry is initially negotiating with three prospective investors, the ministry official said.
Maciej Chojnacki from the ministry's press office told Reuters on Thursday the number of prospective investors participating in the initial talks might be increased later.
He said that in late March or early April the ministry was likely to choose investor or investors for further talks.
"There were more than a dozen offers and now there are three serious potential investors, with whom the ministry is holding initial talks," he said.
He declined to name the firms involved.
In September last year Poland invited bids for up to 75 percent of in blocks of no less than 10 percent in the Elektrocieplownia Krakow, southern Poland.
The ministry earmarked up to 20 percent of the company for employees and five percent for a planned fund to meet claims for property confiscated under communist rule.
The Elektrocieplownia Krakow had a net profit of 26.7 million zlotys on 236.7 million turnover in 1995.
